posts.message:
[align=center][img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/3-gray.png[/img]

[b][size=xx-large][color=#ffffff][u]Hack Forum News - Edition 19[/u][/color][/size][/b]

[b]Welcome back to the Hack Forum News. Where we keep you up to date on the weekly events and news happening on site and around the world. If you have never heard of the Hack Forum News, don't worry, we have you covered. We are a team of members from the Hack Forums community who are journalists and writers, and we are here to keep you in the loop of the changes around the site and the events happening around the world.[/b]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/headlines-red.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

[u][b][size=large][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6309469][color=#ffffff]OctoberFest 2025[/color][/url][/size][/b][/u] By [mention=1]

Octoberfest is soon to end! We have seen a massive increase of activity across the site and, with the event, [mention=1] has announced a giveaway that includes over $2000 worth of prizes to be won. And the award for this year's event has been released, and a few members have already managed to get it twice. If you haven't seen this yet, then it's worth checking out and seeing what prizes are up for grabs this year, and you might even get lucky and get yourself a free $500.

[u][b][size=large][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6299866][color=#ffffff]Hack Forums News Team - Become a Writer[/color][/url][/size][/b][/u] By [mention=2331053]

Are you looking to join the HF news team? Do you enjoy making threads or even want to become a better writer? Well, we are looking for members of the site to help write each week and are looking for anyone who has any interest. We have a few new sections opening up right now, and we would love for you to see if they would be anything of interest to you. If you are interested, please check out the thread or contact Mix to discuss joining the team behind the HF News.

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/statistics-magenta.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

[/color][/b]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/notable.png[/img]

[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=5655318]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6310986]Hackforums Convo project[/url][/color][/size][/b][/u] - [b]by [mention=1763754] [/b]

A fresh collaboration worth keeping an eye on. Originally created by [b] [mention=5495781] [/b], the "Convo Project" brings a next-level collaboration in HF community. The project aims to build a desktop version of HF's convo, with plans to integrate the HF API for features like [url=https://hackforums.net/quickthread.php][url=https://hackforums.net/quickthread.php]Quick Thread[/url][/url] previews, fast replies, and a slicker UI. It's still early days, but seeing members team up to build community tools like this is always exciting.

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311495][Benevolence] Slacker Saturday[/url][/color][/size][/b][/u] - [b]by [mention=1486387] [/b]

The final thread in [b] [mention=1486387] [/b]‚Äôs legendary weekly series is here - [b]Slacker Saturday[/b]. This chill hangout continues the run of themed discussions including [i]Shitpost Sunday, The Monday Club, Tangent Tuesday, Wildcard Wednesday, Trashtalk Thursday,[/i] and [i]Friday Free For All[/i]. It's all about relaxing, chatting, and enjoying the slower side of HF life. If you‚Äôve missed any of the week's entries, now is the perfect time to catch up and join the conversation.

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311471]Most expensive collectible you own?[/url][/color][/size][/b][/u] - [b]by [mention=4225267] [/b]

What's your priciest piece of memorabilia? [b] [mention=4225267] [/b] kicked off a fun and nostalgic thread asking members about their most expensive collectibles, from signed sports gear to Gundam figures (yes, [b] [mention=1618863] [/b] got a shoutout). It's a great blend of curiosity and community storytelling. Join and share your unique items!

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311470]Introducing Method Crypter DEMO[/url][/color][/size][/b][/u] - [b]by [mention=5696896] [/b]

New member [b] [mention=5696896] [/b] drops a well-documented technical showcase with his open-source [b]Method Crypter DEMO[/b]. Built in C# 4.8, it encrypts methods inside executables using clever "junk methods" to avoid corruption. The project demonstrates advanced concepts like AES-based payload decryption, server validation, and runtime security, all fully open source. It's refreshing to see quality development threads like this from fresh faces.

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311505][Legends] Open Source - Link Shortening & Analytics Dashboard[/url][/color][/size][/b][/u] - [b]by [mention=4931690] [/b]

[mention=4931690] shared an open-source project called [b]ishortn.ink[/b], a URL shortener with analytics and tracking. It‚Äôs a fork of an existing GitHub repo but comes with a focus on flexibility and privacy. The post dives into how link tracking, fingerprinting, and domain rotation can serve both analytics and freedom-of-speech purposes. There's even a teaser about a "no log" version in the works. if you're into security, data analytics, or privacy tools, this one's worth checking out.

[hr]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/music-header.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

Recently we introduced a brand-new section to the HF News. This section will grow over time to more things, but for now we are just going to be doing Song of the week. We are open to what more we could bring to the section from your suggestions, but as a start, we feel adding the song of the week will be a great start for the section and lead the way forward for more things in the future.

Now we know some of you may question what the song of the week is all about, and we have thought of what a great answer. We feel like the song of the week should be a meaningful song that goes deeper than just general music and has meaning to it all. Granted, we may have a little fun with it sometimes. (Yes, we will have a Halloween version and Christmas version too.) But we want to keep it at a level where we have found the song has a true message behind it all and not just something that everyone will just see as another song that is just a bit catchy or got a good few beats to it. We hope this helps those with that question and if anyone has anything that they wish to ask, please feel free to add them below. We are more than happy to give the reason behind it.

This weeks Song Of The Week:
[video=youtube]https://youtu.be/qGf6QFB_rEI?list=RD3z661AY1PGc[/video]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/contests.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=3929084]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6310206]
$100 Crypto Contest - Celebrating my entrance to Quantum[/url] By [mention=5655318] [/color][/size][/b][/u]

A new contest has been created this week by [mention=5655318] . He is celebrating hi entrance to the new group Quantum by giving away $100. Make sure to enter!

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311326]üéØ Win the Handgun Award for Just $30 ‚Äì FPS Video Challenge[/Url] by [mention=7] [/color][/size][/b][/u]

well, this is an interesting one. Not necessarily a giveaway but an opportunity to win the ability to purchase a custom award for just $30. To enter you need to create a video of you playing an FPS game. More information click the link!

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6311156]MAXIMUM SECURITY UPLOAD - Can you HACK IT? $20 XMR[/Url] by [mention=630163] [/color][/size][/b][/u]

Another cool challenge giveaway thread! The rules are simple, hack the website OP created using AI and provide proof then claim your $20!

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/world-header.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Shift in Bolivia‚Äôs presidency[/color][/size][/b][/u]

Rodrigo‚ÄØPaz‚ÄØPereira has been elected president in Bolivia‚Äôs runoff election ‚Äî signaling a clear move to the right. It marks the first time since 2005 that a candidate from the long-dominant Movement for Socialism (MAS) party was not on the presidential ballot.

[b][url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/oct/20/rodrigo-paz-pereira-bolivia-wins-presidential-runoff-electiion-right-wing]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]North Korea-South Korea defection across the DMZ[/color][/size][/b][/u]

A soldier from North‚ÄØKorea has some how successfully crossed the heavily fortified land border into South‚ÄØKorea, as confirmed by South Korea‚Äôs military.

[b][url=https://www.cbsnews.com/news/north-korean-soldier-defects-to-south-korea-dmz]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Leadership change in Taiwan‚Äôs opposition party[/color][/size][/b][/u]

Cheng‚ÄØLi‚Äëwun has been elected leader of the opposition Kuomintang party in Taiwan. She takes over from 1 November and emphasises a policy of ‚Äúpeace‚Äù with China.

[b][url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/10/19/taiwan-opposition-elects-new-leader-who-wants-peace-with-china]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]UK under pressure not to cut global health funding[/color][/size][/b][/u]

Keir‚ÄØStarmer (UK Prime Minister) is facing domestic and international pressure to maintain the UK‚Äôs ¬£1 billion contribution to the Global‚ÄØFund‚ÄØto‚ÄØFight‚ÄØAIDS,‚ÄØTuberculosis‚ÄØand‚ÄØMalaria. Rumours of a 20% cut are circulating ahead of a replenishment summit the UK co-chairs.

[b][url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2025/oct/20/keir-starmer-uk-contribution-to-global-fund-aids-malaria]Source[/url][/b]

[/align]
posts.subject: Hack Forum News - Edition 19

posts.message:
[align=center][img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/user-gray.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

[mention=5252466] has reached 10,000 posts.
[mention=5458992] has reached 10,000 posts.

[b]
[size=large]Remember if you have reached an achievement on your account feel free to post about it on our weekly reports thread. That way we can add you to the news for the next edition. [u][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6299864]Click Here To See The Weekly Reports Thread[/url][/u][/size]
[/b]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/tech-brown.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer - [/b][/size]  [mention=5465469]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Cyber defenders sound the alarm as F5 Networks hack exposes broad risks[/color][/size][/b][/u]  
A prolonged intrusion at F5 Networks, a major infrastructure vendor serving many Fortune 500 companies and federal systems which resulted in source-code and vulnerability data theft. Analysts liken the scope to the 2020 SolarWinds compromise.  
[b][url=https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/boards-policy-regulation/cyber-defenders-sound-alarm-f5-hack-exposes-broad-risks-2025-10-20/]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Envoy Air hit in Oracle E-Business Suite-linked hacking campaign[/color][/size][/b][/u]  
Envoy Air confirms it was targeted in an extortion campaign exploiting Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerabilities. No sensitive customer data has been confirmed stolen, but business contacts may have been accessed.  
[b][url=https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/boards-policy-regulation/envoy-air-targeted-oracle-linked-hacking-campaign-2025-10-17/]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Five new exploited bugs land in CISA‚Äôs Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog[/color][/size][/b][/u]  
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency has added five vulnerabilities, including two in Oracle‚Äôs EBS suite, to its KEV catalog after real-world exploitation evidence emerged.  
[b][url=https://thehackernews.com/2025/10/five-new-exploited-bugs-land-in-cisas.html]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]Wojeski & Company settles for data-protection failures after two ransomware incidents[/color][/size][/b][/u]  
New York Attorney General announces settlement with accounting firm Wojeski & Company following ransomware and data-breach incidents exposing the personal information of more than 4,700 New York residents.  
[b][url=https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/2025/attorney-general-james-announces-settlement-accounting-firm-failing-protect-new]Source[/url][/b]

[u][b][size=large][color=#ffffff]October proclaimed as National Cybersecurity Awareness Month in the U.S.[/color][/size][/b][/u]  
The White House formally proclaims October 2025 as National Cybersecurity Awareness Month, renewing commitments to defend digital rights, strengthen encryption protocols, and promote secure technology practices.  
[b][url=https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/10/national-cybersecurity-awareness-month-2025/]Source[/url][/b]

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/spec-ops.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=5550319]

[color=#E82A1F][b]WEEKLY CYBERSECURITY DIGEST[/b][/color]
A professional summary of the latest global infosec developments, threat intelligence, and critical vulnerabilities ‚Äî updated for the week of October 13‚Äì19, 2025.

[color=#E82A1F][b]NEWS HIGHLIGHTS[/b][/color]

[color=#E82A1F][b]F5 Networks Breach ‚Äî Federal Warning Issued[/b][/color]
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has released an emergency advisory following a confirmed breach at [b]F5 Networks[/b]. Nation-state actors reportedly accessed internal systems and exfiltrated portions of the BIG-IP source code. CISA has instructed all federal agencies to immediately assess and patch any affected infrastructure running vulnerable F5 software.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://www.techradar.com/pro/security/significant-threat-to-us-networks-after-hackers-stole-f5-source-code-cisa-warns?utm_source=chatgpt.com

[color=#E82A1F][b]DPRK Adopts EtherHiding: Nation-State Malware Concealed on Blockchains[/b][/color]
Google‚Äôs Threat Intelligence Group (GTIG) has identified a new campaign by [b]UNC5342[/b], a North Korean threat actor, leveraging a novel tactic known as [i]EtherHiding[/i]. This technique embeds malicious payloads directly within blockchain transactions, making takedown and blocklisting efforts nearly impossible. The group has been observed deploying this method for crypto theft and espionage operations ‚Äî marking the first documented use of blockchain-based payload delivery by a nation-state.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/dprk-adopts-etherhiding

[color=#E82A1F][b]Microsoft Patches Record-Severity ASP.NET Core Flaw[/b][/color]
Microsoft has issued a fix for [b]CVE-2025-55315[/b], a critical HTTP request smuggling vulnerability within the [b]Kestrel ASP.NET Core web server[/b]. Labeled as the ‚Äúhighest-severity ASP.NET Core flaw ever,‚Äù this bug allows authenticated attackers to bypass front-end security controls, hijack session data, or disrupt server operations. Microsoft recommends all administrators update their .NET frameworks, rebuild applications, and redeploy environments immediately.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-fixes-highest-severity-aspnet-core-flaw-ever/

[color=#E82A1F][b]Envoy Air Compromised in Oracle Exploit Campaign[/b][/color]
[b]Envoy Air[/b], a subsidiary of American Airlines, reported unauthorized access linked to exploitation of Oracle E-Business Suite vulnerabilities. The incident is associated with the Cl0p ransomware group, known for data-theft-driven extortion. While no flight or passenger data was impacted, internal operational systems were affected.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://www.reuters.com/sustainability/boards-policy-regulation/envoy-air-targeted-oracle-linked-hacking-campaign-2025-10-17/?utm_source=chatgpt.com

[color=#E82A1F][b]CISA Workforce Reductions Raise National Security Concerns[/b][/color]
The Department of Homeland Security confirmed that [b]176 cybersecurity staff[/b] at CISA were recently laid off or reassigned. The cuts come amid rising global threat activity, sparking warnings that national cyber defense operations may face slower response times and reduced incident-handling capacity.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://www.techradar.com/pro/security/cisa-staff-fired-in-a-fresh-cuts-for-trumps-administration-some-forcibly-reassigned-to-ice?utm_source=chatgpt.com

[color=#E82A1F][b]National Guard Expands Cyber-Defense Role for U.S. Cities[/b][/color]
The U.S. Army National Guard will now assist major metropolitan areas in protecting critical infrastructure such as water, energy, and emergency communication systems. The expansion represents a growing public‚Äìmilitary partnership to reinforce digital resilience at the municipal level.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Source:[/b][/color] https://www.businessinsider.com/national-guard-units-help-defend-against-cyber-attacks-2025-10?utm_source=chatgpt.com

[color=#E82A1F][b]RECENT VULNERABILITY DISCLOSURES[/b][/color]

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-24990[/b][/color]
A long-standing modem driver vulnerability (Agere Modem) has resurfaced in legacy Windows builds. Active exploitation in the wild prompted Microsoft‚Äôs emergency patch.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Remove outdated drivers and apply the October 2025 cumulative security update.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-59287[/b][/color]
Remote code execution in [b]Windows Server Update Services (WSUS)[/b] via unsafe data deserialization allows attackers to execute arbitrary code with administrative privileges.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Apply security updates and restrict WSUS access to authorized network zones.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-59236 / CVE-2025-59234 / CVE-2025-59227[/b][/color]
A trio of Microsoft Office vulnerabilities enabling privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution through maliciously crafted Excel files.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Update all Office deployments and enforce macro-blocking policies.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-48004[/b][/color]
A kernel flaw in the [b]Cloud Files Mini-Filter Driver[/b] enables arbitrary code execution with SYSTEM privileges.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Patch OneDrive-enabled endpoints immediately.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-55676[/b][/color]
A Windows Kernel validation bug allowing local attackers to escalate privileges to full system control.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Apply patches and audit kernel-level process creation logs.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-55681[/b][/color]
Windows Error Reporting Service vulnerability that can trigger SYSTEM-level execution via malformed diagnostic submissions.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Patch critical systems and disable unnecessary diagnostic services.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-58722[/b][/color]
Local privilege escalation possible via unsafe metadata parsing in the [b]Cloud Files driver[/b].
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Deploy latest cumulative updates and isolate untrusted sync clients.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-59199[/b][/color]
Improper kernel memory handling allows privilege escalation and potential system instability.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Update kernel modules and monitor for crash loops or unexpected process injections.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-55680[/b][/color]
Flaw in the Windows Diagnostic Hub Collector could enable remote code execution through telemetry manipulation.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Apply all pending updates and limit remote telemetry submission.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-55692[/b][/color]
Registry permission misconfiguration in [b]Network Location Awareness Service[/b] can lead to unauthorized privilege escalation.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Verify registry access control lists and apply October security updates.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-55694[/b][/color]
An input validation issue in [b]Windows Error Reporting[/b] permits code execution via malicious payload injection.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Patch affected systems and disable WER in restricted environments.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-59194[/b][/color]
Race condition within the [b]Common Log File System (CLFS)[/b] driver may grant attackers kernel-level access.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Apply patches and monitor for irregular log file behavior.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-59502[/b][/color]
Critical [b]HTTP.sys[/b] vulnerability allows unauthenticated remote code execution via crafted web requests.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Patch all web servers and configure firewalls to block suspicious HTTP headers.

[color=#E82A1F][b]CVE-2025-61882[/b][/color]
A critical remote code execution flaw in [b]Oracle E-Business Suite‚Äôs BI Publisher Integration[/b] actively exploited by the Cl0p ransomware group.
[color=#FF30DC][b]Action:[/b][/color] Patch Oracle EBS immediately, disable unneeded components, and check for recent unauthorized access attempts.

[hr]

[img]https://hackforums.net/images/hfnews/comics-magenta.png[/img]
[size=medium][b]Writer -[/b][/size] [mention=2331053]

[b][size=x-large][color=#ffffff]-1-[/color][/size][/b]
[spoiler][img]https://www.boredpanda.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/honest-funny-comics-yogricha-verma-cover_675.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[b][size=x-large][color=#ffffff]-2-[/color][/size][/b]
[spoiler][img]https://kfs.merlinone.net/thumbsx/2025/10/tdir3573/kfs1_x296_4108_9.jpg[/img][/spoiler]

[b][size=x-large][color=#ffffff]-3-[/color][/size][/b]
